column1: Isengar Took was a Hobbits of the Shire.

Isengar was the youngest child of Gerontius Took. He was one of several youngsters inspired by Gandalf to travel outside of the Shire; it is told that he saw the Belegaer in his youth.   When Bilbo Baggins was young he used to pester Gandalf for information about Hobbits who had "gone off"
The name contains isen "iron" and gar "spear".Jim Allan (ed.)
